body_html:
@jhseu : That could be added but would need to also make clear what transposed arguments also work, and that "matching" for a, ..., z and a', ..., z' means they can both be absent.

I'm partial to using the proposed

The inputs must, following any transpositions, be tensors of rank ≥ 2 where the inner 2 dimensions specify valid matrix multiplication arguments, and any further outer dimensions match.

Since even if it's a bit hard to parse at first, the example (which I agree should be added) clears it up.

body:
@jhseu : That could be added but would need to also make clear what transposed arguments also work, and that "matching" for  a, ..., z and a', ..., z' means they can both be absent.

I'm partial to using the proposed

> The inputs must, following any transpositions, be tensors of rank ≥ 2 where the inner 2 dimensions specify valid matrix multiplication arguments, and any further outer dimensions match.

Since even if it's a bit hard to parse at first, the example (which I agree should be added) clears it up.
